text: Lepetodrilus elevatus is a species of small, deep-sea sea snail, a hydrothermal vent limpet, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Lepetodrilidae. ==Description== ==Distribution== This species occurs in hydrothermal vents and seeps of the East Pacific Rise. ==References== * Warén A. & Bouchet P. (2001). Gastropoda and Monoplacophora from hydrothermal vents and seeps new taxa and records. The Veliger, 44(2): 116-231 ==External links== * Stephen Hunt, Structure and Composition of the Shell of the Archaeogastropod Limpet Lepetodrilus elevatus elevatus (Mclean 1988), Malacologia 1992 34 (1-2): 129-141 Category:Lepetodrilidae Category:Gastropods described in 1988
title: Lepetodrilus elevatus
